com.luigisgro.cqf.montecarlo
Interface MonteCarloEvaluator<T extends TimePoint>

Type Parameters:
T -
All Known Implementing Classes:
CurveTimeSeriesOperatorEvaluator, StandardErrorEvaluator
public interface MonteCarloEvaluator<T extends TimePoint>

Objects responsible for calculating the derivative value corresponding to a given iteration of the Monte Carlo simulation, from a state of the underlying (scenario). It also defines the criteria to stop simulation.

Author:
Luigi Sgro

Method Summary
 double evaluateAndAccumulate(CurveTimeSeries<T> scenario)
          At each iteration, the algorithm feeds the evaluator with a new scenario, which describes a complete time series for the underlying.

          This method returns the running result of the simulation.

          This method must be called at each iteration to test the need for more iterations
 void printProgress()

Method Detail

evaluateAndAccumulate

double evaluateAndAccumulate(CurveTimeSeries<T> scenario)
At each iteration, the algorithm feeds the evaluator with a new scenario, which describes a complete time series for the underlying. Each time this method is called, the evaluator performs an evaluation of the value of the derivative, it updates its internal value, and decides if the simulation can stop or if it must carry on for another iteration

Parameters:
scenario - The complete time series describing a possible scenario for the underlying
Returns:
the evaluation of the current scenario

moreIterationsNeeded

boolean moreIterationsNeeded()
This method must be called at each iteration to test the need for more iterations

Returns:
True if the simulation must continue, false if it reached a suitable result

getResult

double getResult()
This method returns the running result of the simulation. When the simulation is finished, it returns the final value.

Returns:
The result of the simulation

printProgress

void printProgress()
Print a user-friendly summary of the status of the simulation
